datasets.name: e5c48fa4
datasets.query: SELECT * FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline WHERE result_state IS NOT NULL;

datasets.name: cc789c72
datasets.query:
with job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.job_id,
    t2.run_id,
    t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
    t2.result_state,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2
      ON
        t1.workspace_id=t2.workspace_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id = t2.run_id
        AND t1.usage_start_time >= date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_start_time)
        AND t1.usage_start_time < date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_end_time) + INTERVAL 1 HOUR
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' AND 
    t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
cumulative_run_status_cost as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id, 
    job_id,
    run_id,
    run_as,
    result_state,
    usage_end_time,
    SUM(list_cost) OVER (ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS cumulative_cost
  FROM job_run_timeline_with_cost
  ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time
),
cost_per_status as (
  SELECT
      workspace_id, 
      job_id,
      run_id,
      run_as,
      result_state,
      usage_end_time,
      cumulative_cost - COALESCE(LAG(cumulative_cost) OVER (ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time), 0) AS result_state_cost
  FROM cumulative_run_status_cost
  WHERE result_state IS NOT NULL
  ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time),
cost_per_unsuccesful_status_agg as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id, 
    job_id,
    run_id,
    first(run_as, TRUE) as run_as,
    SUM(result_state_cost) as list_cost
  FROM cost_per_status
  WHERE
    result_state != "SUCCEEDED"
  GROUP BY ALL
),
repaired_runs as (
  SELECT 
    workspace_id, job_id, run_id, COUNT(*) as cnt
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE result_state IS NOT NULL
  GROUP BY ALL
  HAVING cnt > 1
),
successful_repairs as (
  SELECT t1.workspace_id, t1.job_id, t1.run_id, MAX(t1.period_end_time) as period_end_time
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t1
  JOIN repaired_runs t2
  ON t1.workspace_id=t2.workspace_id AND t1.job_id=t2.job_id AND t1.run_id=t2.run_id
  WHERE t1.result_state="SUCCEEDED"
  GROUP BY ALL
),
combined_repairs as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.period_end_time, 
    t1.cnt as repairs
  FROM repaired_runs t1
    LEFT JOIN successful_repairs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id, run_id)
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT
  last(t3.name) as name,
  t1.workspace_id,
  t1.job_id,
  t1.run_id,
  first(t4.run_as, TRUE) as run_as,
  first(t1.repairs) - 1 as repairs,
  first(t4.list_cost) as repair_list_cost,
  CASE WHEN t1.period_end_time IS NOT NULL THEN CAST(t1.period_end_time - MIN(t2.period_end_time) as LONG) ELSE NULL END AS repair_time_seconds
FROM combined_repairs t1
  JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id, run_id)
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  LEFT JOIN cost_per_unsuccesful_status_agg t4 USING (workspace_id, job_id, run_id)
WHERE
  t2.result_state IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY t1.workspace_id, t1.job_id, t1.run_id, t1.period_end_time
ORDER BY repairs DESC

datasets.name: bb7e5c78
datasets.query:
with jobs_usage_with_list_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' 
),
weekly_jobs_list_cost as (
  select
    date_sub(to_date(usage_start_time), dayofweek(to_date(usage_start_time))) as week_start,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    COUNT(distinct to_date(usage_start_time)) as days
  from
    jobs_usage_with_list_cost t1 
  group by all
  having days = 7
  order by 1 asc, 2 asc
),
list_cost_growth as (
    select
        week_start,
        list_cost,
        100 * (list_cost - lag(list_cost, 1) over (order by week_start)) / lag(list_cost, 1) over (order by week_start) as weekly_growth
    from weekly_jobs_list_cost
    order by week_start asc
)
select
    week_start,
    weekly_growth,
    avg(weekly_growth) over (order by week_start ROWS BETWEEN 12 preceding AND CURRENT ROW) as 3_months_growth_moving_avg,
    list_cost
from list_cost_growth

datasets.name: 3b0096b1
datasets.query:
with producers as (
  SELECT 
    workspace_id, entity_id as job_id, target_table_full_name, created_by
  FROM
    system.access.table_lineage
  WHERE
    entity_type="JOB" AND 
    target_table_full_name IS NOT NULL AND
    event_date > CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
  GROUP BY ALL
),
consumers as (
  SELECT 
    workspace_id, source_table_full_name
  FROM
    system.access.table_lineage
  WHERE
    source_table_full_name IS NOT NULL AND event_date > CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
  GROUP BY ALL
),
jobs_with_datasets as (
  SELECT 
    workspace_id, entity_id as job_id, collect_set(target_table_full_name) as populated_sets
  FROM
    system.access.table_lineage
  WHERE
    entity_type="JOB" AND 
    target_table_full_name IS NOT NULL
  GROUP BY ALL
),
jobs_without_consumption as (
  SELECT 
    t1.*
  FROM producers t1
    LEFT OUTER JOIN consumers t2
      ON t1.target_table_full_name = t2.source_table_full_name AND t1.workspace_id=t2.workspace_id
),
job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id,
    t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default AS list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices 
      ON
        t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud AND
        t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name AND
        t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time AND
        (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' AND
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL AND
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL
),
agg_cost as (
  SELECT 
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    FIRST(run_as, TRUE) as run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost
  FROM job_run_timeline_with_cost
  WHERE
    usage_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS 
  GROUP BY ALL
  ORDER BY list_cost DESC
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT
  t1.workspace_id,
  t5.name, 
  t1.job_id,
  collect_set(target_table_full_name) as not_used_datasets,
  array_except(first(t3.populated_sets), collect_set(target_table_full_name)) as used_datasets,
  first(t4.run_as) as run_as,
  date(MAX(t2.period_end_time)) as last_seen_job_date,
  COUNT(DISTINCT t2.run_id) as runs,
  first(t4.list_cost) as list_cost_30d
FROM 
  jobs_without_consumption t1 
    INNER JOIN jobs_with_datasets t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
    LEFT JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
    LEFT JOIN agg_cost t4 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t5 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL
HAVING runs > 0 -- Exclude old Lineage entries for which we don't have jobs data
ORDER BY list_cost_30d DESC, runs DESC

datasets.name: d0be2fcd
datasets.query:
with job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
    t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default AS list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices 
      ON
        t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud AND
        t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name AND
        t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time AND
        (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' AND
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL AND
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL AND
    t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 14 DAY
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT
    t2.name
    ,t1.workspace_id
    ,t1.job_id
    ,t1.sku_name
    ,t1.run_as
    ,Last7DaySpend
    ,Last14DaySpend
    ,last7DaySpend - last14DaySpend as Last7DayGrowth
    ,try_divide( (last7DaySpend - last14DaySpend) , last14DaySpend) * 100 AS Last7DayGrowthPct
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      workspace_id,
      job_id,
      run_as,
      sku_name,
      SUM(list_cost) AS spend
      ,SUM(CASE WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -8) AND date_add(current_date(), -1) THEN list_cost ELSE 0 END) AS Last7DaySpend
      ,SUM(CASE WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -15) AND date_add(current_date(), -8) THEN list_cost ELSE 0 END) AS Last14DaySpend
    FROM job_run_timeline_with_cost
    GROUP BY ALL
  ) t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
ORDER BY 
  Last7DayGrowth DESC 
LIMIT 100

datasets.name: ec3ae3de
datasets.query:
with job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.cloud,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t2.job_id,
    t2.run_id,
    t2.result_state,
    t1.usage_start_time,
    t1.usage_end_time,
    t1.sku_name,
    t1.usage_unit,
    t1.usage_quantity,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default AS list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2
      ON
        t1.workspace_id=t2.workspace_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id = t2.run_id
        AND t1.usage_start_time >= date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_start_time)
        AND t1.usage_start_time < date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_end_time) + INTERVAL 1 HOUR
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices 
      ON
        t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud AND
        t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name AND
        t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time AND
        (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
),
cumulative_run_status_cost as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id, 
    job_id,
    run_id,
    result_state,
    usage_start_time,
    usage_end_time,
    SUM(list_cost) OVER (ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS cumulative_cost
  FROM job_run_timeline_with_cost
  ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time
  )
SELECT
    workspace_id, 
    job_id,
    run_id,
    result_state,
    usage_start_time,
    usage_end_time,
    cumulative_cost - COALESCE(LAG(cumulative_cost) OVER (ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time), 0) AS result_state_cost
FROM cumulative_run_status_cost
WHERE result_state IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time

with jobs_usage_with_list_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' 
    AND usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS 
),
jobs_usage_per_workspace as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id, 
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost
  FROM jobs_usage_with_list_cost
  GROUP BY ALL
)
SELECT 
    t1.workspace_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.job_id) as num_jobs,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.run_id) as num_runs,
    first(t2.list_cost) as list_cost
FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t1
  LEFT JOIN jobs_usage_per_workspace t2 USING (workspace_id)
WHERE
  period_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS 
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC

SELECT
  t1.*,
  t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
  t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id,
  t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
  t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default AS list_cost
FROM system.billing.usage t1
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices 
    ON
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud AND
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name AND
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time AND
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL)
WHERE
  t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' AND
  t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL AND 
  t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL

datasets.name: d9fed998
datasets.query:
with list_cost_per_job as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as runs,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT 
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.runs,
    t1.run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    t1.last_seen_date
FROM list_cost_per_job t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC

datasets.name: 78ad8eef
datasets.query:
-- SPENDING BROKEN DOWN BY JOB
with stats_per_job_run as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen,
    MIN(t1.usage_start_time) as first_seen
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
      t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
      AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
      AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL
      AND t1.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY 1,2,3
), 
stats_per_job AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    COUNT(run_id) AS runs,
    SUM(list_cost) AS total_list_cost,
    AVG(list_cost) AS avg_list_cost,
    MAX(list_cost) AS max_list_cost,
    percentile(list_cost, 0.9) AS p90
  FROM
    stats_per_job_run
  WHERE
    first_seen > CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
  GROUP BY ALL
  ORDER BY
    total_list_cost DESC
)
SELECT
  *,
  (max_list_cost - p90) AS list_cost_deviation_from_p90
FROM
  stats_per_job
ORDER BY
  list_cost_deviation_from_p90 DESC

datasets.name: 0655a5b3
datasets.query:
with jobs_usage_with_list_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
)
SELECT
    *
    ,try_divide( (last30DaySpend - last30to60DaySpend) , last30to60DaySpend) * 100 AS Last30DayGrowth
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      SUM(list_cost) AS spend
      ,sku_name
      ,SUM(CASE WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -30) AND current_date() THEN list_cost ELSE 0 END) AS Last30DaySpend
      ,SUM(CASE WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -60) AND date_add(current_date(), -31) THEN list_cost ELSE 0 END) AS Last30to60DaySpend
    FROM jobs_usage_with_list_cost
    GROUP BY ALL
  )

datasets.name: 6fa8cef7
datasets.query:
with list_cost_per_job_run as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),

most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT 
    t1.workspace_id,
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.run_id,
     t1.run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    t1.last_seen_date
FROM list_cost_per_job_run t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC

datasets.name: 732b1d02
datasets.query:
with job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
    t2.job_id,
    t2.run_id,
    t2.result_state,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2
      ON
        t1.workspace_id=t2.workspace_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id = t2.run_id
        AND t1.usage_start_time >= date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_start_time)
        AND t1.usage_start_time < date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_end_time) + INTERVAL 1 HOUR
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' AND 
    t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
cumulative_run_status_cost as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id, 
    job_id,
    run_id,
    run_as,
    result_state,
    usage_end_time,
    SUM(list_cost) OVER (ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS cumulative_cost
  FROM job_run_timeline_with_cost
  ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time
),
cost_per_status as (
  SELECT
      workspace_id, 
      job_id,
      run_id,
      run_as,
      result_state,
      usage_end_time,
      cumulative_cost - COALESCE(LAG(cumulative_cost) OVER (ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time), 0) AS result_state_cost
  FROM cumulative_run_status_cost
  WHERE result_state IS NOT NULL
  ORDER BY workspace_id, job_id, run_id, usage_end_time),
cost_per_status_agg as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id, 
    job_id,
    FIRST(run_as, TRUE) as run_as,
    SUM(result_state_cost) as list_cost
  FROM cost_per_status
  WHERE
    result_state IN ('ERROR', 'FAILED', 'TIMED_OUT')
  GROUP BY ALL
),
terminal_statues as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    CASE WHEN result_state IN ('ERROR', 'FAILED', 'TIMED_OUT') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END as is_failure,
    period_end_time as last_seen_date
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE 
    result_state IS NOT NULL AND
    period_end_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT
  first(t2.name) as name, 
  t1.workspace_id,
  t1.job_id,
  COUNT(*) as runs,
  t3.run_as,
  SUM(is_failure) as failures,
  (1 - COALESCE(try_divide(SUM(is_failure), COUNT(*)), 0)) * 100 as success_ratio,
  first(t3.list_cost) as failure_list_cost,
  MAX(t1.last_seen_date) as last_seen_date
FROM terminal_statues t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  LEFT JOIN cost_per_status_agg t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL 
ORDER BY failures DESC

datasets.name: 2dbf594a
datasets.query:
with list_cost_per_job_cluster as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.cluster_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as runs,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
	and t1.sku_name not ilike '%jobs_serverless%'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
),

jobsrollingmonth as (
SELECT 
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.cluster_id,
    t1.runs,
    t1.run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    t1.last_seen_date
FROM list_cost_per_job_cluster t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC ),

clusterutil as (SELECT * from 
	system.compute.node_timeline
WHERE
	start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
),

jobswithutil as (
select jobsrollingmonth.workspace_id, jobsrollingmonth.name,
avg(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Avg CPU Utilization`, 
max(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Peak CPU Utilization`, 
	avg(cpu_wait_percent) as `Avg CPU Disk Wait`,
	max(cpu_wait_percent) as `Max CPU Disk Wait`,
	avg(mem_used_percent) as `Avg Memory Utilization`, 
	max(mem_used_percent) as `Max Memory Utilization`
from clusterutil 
join jobsrollingmonth
on clusterutil.cluster_id = jobsrollingmonth.cluster_id
group by 1, 2),

finalutil as (
  select jobswithutil.*, sum(jobsrollingmonth.list_cost) as jobcostrolling30
  from jobswithutil
  join jobsrollingmonth
  on jobswithutil.workspace_id = jobsrollingmonth.workspace_id
  AND jobswithutil.name = jobsrollingmonth.name 
  group by ALL
)

select *, ((jobcostrolling30 * (1 - (`Avg CPU Utilization` / 100))) / 2.0) as maxsavings
from finalutil
order by maxsavings desc
limit 25

    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,

    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
	and t1.sku_name not ilike '%jobs_serverless%'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
),

jobsrollingmonth as (
SELECT 
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.cluster_id,
    t1.runs,
    t1.run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    t1.last_seen_date
FROM list_cost_per_job_cluster t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC ),

clusterutil as (SELECT * from 
	system.compute.node_timeline
WHERE
	start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
),

jobswithutil as (
select jobsrollingmonth.workspace_id, jobsrollingmonth.name,
avg(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Avg CPU Utilization`, 
max(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Peak CPU Utilization`, 
	avg(cpu_wait_percent) as `Avg CPU Disk Wait`,
	max(cpu_wait_percent) as `Max CPU Disk Wait`,
	avg(mem_used_percent) as `Avg Memory Utilization`, 
	max(mem_used_percent) as `Max Memory Utilization`
from clusterutil 
join jobsrollingmonth
on clusterutil.cluster_id = jobsrollingmonth.cluster_id
group by 1, 2)

select *
from jobswithutil
order by `Avg CPU Utilization` asc
limit 10

datasets.name: 11611f07
datasets.query:
with tagraw as (
    select explode(custom_tags) as (llave, val), (usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default)
    as list_cost  
    from system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
   t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
	 and t1.sku_name not ilike '%jobs_serverless%'
   and t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
   AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY),

tagspend as ( select concat(llave,':',' ', val) as tagbucket, sum(list_cost) as list_cost
from tagraw 
group by 1),

catchall as (select 'catchall' as tagbucket , sum(usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default)
as list_cost  
    from system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
	 and t1.sku_name not ilike '%jobs_serverless%'
   and t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
    and cardinality(custom_tags) = 0  )

select * from tagspend
union all
select * from catchall
order by list_cost desc
limit 20

datasets.name: eda36d96
datasets.query:
with list_cost_per_job_cluster as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.cluster_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as runs,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
	and t1.sku_name not ilike '%jobs_serverless%'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
),

jobsrollingmonth as (
SELECT 
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.cluster_id,
    t1.runs,
    t1.run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    t1.last_seen_date
FROM list_cost_per_job_cluster t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC ),

clusters as (SELECT * from 
	system.compute.clusters
WHERE
	delete_time is not null
)

select clusters.workspace_id, jobsrollingmonth.name, jobsrollingmonth.job_id,
jobsrollingmonth.run_as, sum(jobsrollingmonth.list_cost), any_value(dbr_Version) from 
clusters join jobsrollingmonth
on clusters.cluster_id = jobsrollingmonth.cluster_id
where left(dbr_version, 1) <> '1'
group by 1, 2, 3, 4

datasets.name: 8aecbfa9
datasets.query:
with list_cost_per_job_cluster as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.cluster_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as runs,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
	  AND t1.sku_name NOT LIKE '%SERVERLESS'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_metadata.cluster_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
),
job_runs_enhanced as (
  SELECT 
      t2.name,
      t1.job_id,
      t1.workspace_id,
      t1.cluster_id,
      t1.runs,
      t1.run_as,
      SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
      t1.last_seen_date
  FROM list_cost_per_job_cluster t1 
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  GROUP BY ALL
  ORDER BY list_cost DESC
),
clusters as (
  SELECT 
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, cluster_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM 
    system.compute.clusters
  WHERE
    cluster_source="JOB"
  QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT
  clusters.workspace_id,
  jobs.job_id,
  first(jobs.name) as name,
  first(jobs.run_as) as run_as,
  SUM(jobs.list_cost) as list_cost,
  first(worker_count) as worker_count,
  first(min_autoscale_workers) as min_autoscale_workers,
  first(max_autoscale_workers) as max_autoscale_workers
FROM clusters
 JOIN job_runs_enhanced jobs USING(workspace_id, cluster_id)
WHERE
  (min_autoscale_workers is NULL OR max_autoscale_workers is NULL)
  and worker_count > 1
GROUP BY 1,2
ORDER BY list_cost DESC

datasets.name: 82bd998a
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
),

runlast30 as (

  select * from system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  where period_end_time > CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL 30 DAY
)


select most_recent_jobs.workspace_id, name, any_value(most_recent_jobs.job_id), 
any_value(tags), any_value(run_as) from most_recent_jobs
join runlast30
on most_recent_jobs.job_id = runlast30.job_id
where cardinality(tags) = 0 
group by all

datasets.name: 07c866cc
datasets.query:
with clusters AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, cluster_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM system.compute.clusters
  WHERE cluster_source="UI"
  QUALIFY rn=1
),
job_tasks_exploded AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    EXPLODE(compute_ids) as cluster_id
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_task_run_timeline
  WHERE period_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
),
all_purpose_cluster_jobs AS (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.cluster_name,
    t2.owned_by,
    t2.dbr_version
  FROM job_tasks_exploded t1 
    INNER JOIN clusters t2 USING (workspace_id, cluster_id)
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT 
  t1.workspace_id,
  t1.job_id,
  first(t2.name, TRUE) as name,
  array_size(collect_list(t1.cluster_id)) as task_runs,
  collect_set(
    named_struct(
      'cluster_id', t1.cluster_id,
      'cluster_name', t1.cluster_name
    )
  ) as clusters_list
FROM all_purpose_cluster_jobs t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY t1.workspace_id, t1.job_id 
ORDER BY task_runs DESC
LIMIT 100;

datasets.name: bdc3301f
datasets.query:
with clusters AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, cluster_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM system.compute.clusters
  WHERE cluster_source="UI"
  QUALIFY rn=1
),
job_tasks_exploded AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    EXPLODE(compute_ids) as cluster_id
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_task_run_timeline
  WHERE period_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
),
all_purpose_cluster_jobs AS (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.cluster_name,
    t2.owned_by,
    t2.dbr_version
  FROM job_tasks_exploded t1 
    INNER JOIN clusters t2 USING (workspace_id, cluster_id)
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
-- )
),
ap_clusters_by_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.cluster_id,
    first(t1.cluster_name, TRUE) as cluster_name,
    array_size(collect_list(t1.cluster_id)) as task_runs,
    collect_set(
      named_struct(
        'job_id', t1.job_id,
        'job_name', t2.name
      )
    ) as jobs_list
  FROM all_purpose_cluster_jobs t1 
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  GROUP BY t1.workspace_id, t1.cluster_id 
  ORDER BY task_runs DESC
  LIMIT 100
)
SELECT
  t1.workspace_id,
  t1.usage_metadata.cluster_id,
  first(t2.cluster_name, TRUE) as cluster_name,
  first(t2.task_runs) as task_runs,
  SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
  first(t2.jobs_list) as jobs_list,
  MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
FROM system.billing.usage t1 
INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
  t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
  t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
  t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
  (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
INNER JOIN ap_clusters_by_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id=t2.workspace_id AND t1.usage_metadata.cluster_id=t2.cluster_id
WHERE usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC

datasets.name: ebc29bad
datasets.query:
WITH agg_data AS (
SELECT ds, usage_start_time, usage_end_time,
       sku1 as sku,
       workspace_id,
       SUM(dbus) AS dbus
FROM (select workspace_id, ds, dbus, sku, usage_start_time, usage_end_time, CASE
           WHEN sku LIKE '%ALL_PURPOSE%' THEN 'ALL_PURPOSE'
           WHEN sku LIKE '%JOBS%' THEN 'JOBS'
           WHEN sku LIKE '%DLT%' THEN 'DLT'
           WHEN sku LIKE '%SQL%' THEN 'SQL'
           WHEN sku LIKE '%INFERENCE%' THEN 'MODEL_INFERENCE'
           ELSE 'OTHER'
           END AS sku1 from (
SELECT u.workspace_id, 
       u.usage_date AS ds, 
       u.sku_name AS sku, 
       usage_start_time, usage_end_time,
       CAST(u.usage_quantity AS DOUBLE) AS dbus
FROM system.billing.usage u 
WHERE u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
))
GROUP BY all)
select * from agg_data 
order by ds desc

datasets.name: 994215cc
datasets.query:
with jobs_usage_with_list_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
      t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
      t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
      t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
      (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%' 
),
most_expensive_jobs_30_days as (
  select 
    usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost
  from
    jobs_usage_with_list_cost
  where usage_metadata.job_id is not null
  AND usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  group by 1
  order by list_cost desc limit :parameter 
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
),
weekly_jobs_list_cost as (
  select
    t1.usage_start_time, t1.usage_end_time,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
    ifnull(t2.name, concat('JobId-', t1.usage_metadata.job_id)) as name,
    t1.sku_name,
    IF(size(t1.custom_tags) = 0 OR t1.custom_tags IS NULL, 
     'Untagged', 
     concat_ws(', ', transform(map_keys(t1.custom_tags), key -> concat(key, ':', t1.custom_tags[key])))
    ) AS tags,
    SUM(t1.list_cost) as list_cost,
    COUNT(t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as no_of_runs
  from
    jobs_usage_with_list_cost t1 
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 
    on t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id and t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
  where usage_metadata.job_id in (select job_id from most_expensive_jobs_30_days)
  group by all
)
select * from weekly_jobs_list_cost;

frame.title: Most Retried Runs Last 30 Days
frame.description:
- NULL repair time means there was no successful repair (yet)
- We include all the jobs, but the run_as/repair_$list are calculated only for these running on serverless or job clusters.

frame.title: Highest Failure Jobs Last 30 Days
frame.description: We include all the jobs, but the run_as/failure_$list are calculated only for these running on serverless or job clusters.

widget.name: ed508f60
widget.textbox_spec:
## Tutorial

---

### How to get a job by ID?
1. Copy the job_id
2. Navigate to the correct workspace
3. Paste the job ID in a top search toolbar
4. Press enter

### How to get a job run by ID?
1. Follow the *How to get a job by ID?* section
2. Copy run ID
3. Open *any run* on the job runs page
4. Replace the run ID in the url after `/runs/` part
    1. *https://sample-workspace.databricks.com/jobs/123456789/runs/**111213141516***

widget.name: e8fc41c4
widget.textbox_spec:
## Jobs System Tables Dashboard  v0.2

--- 

This dashboard operates on a list cost (**$list**). The list cost is calculated as `number of DBUs * list price per DBU at that moment in time`. Account-specific rates and discounts are excluded.

We will be evolving it over time by adding more example queries and visualizations. The latest version will always be available in the GitHub link below.

#### Documentation 
- Jobs System Tables (Public Preview)
- [Latest Dashboard version GitHub](https://github.com/databricks/tmm/blob/main/System-Tables-Demo/Jobs-PrPr/Jobs%20System%20Tables%20Dashboard.lvdash.json)

#### Requirements
- For the full experience, this dashboard requires select rights on **system.usage**,  **system.compute**, **system.lakeflow** and **system.access.table_lineage** System Tables
    - [How to Enable System Table Schema](https://docs.databricks.com/en/administration-guide/system-tables/index.html#enable-system-table-schemas)
    - [Grant access to system tables](https://docs.databricks.com/en/administration-guide/system-tables/index.html#grant-access-to-system-tables)

#### Debugging
For detailed debugging instructions (how to find a job/run by ID) check out the guidance at the bottom of this dashboard.

frame.title: Jobs Outliers Last 30 Days
frame.description: Analyse the job's $list deviation across multiple runs.

frame.title: Most Expensive Workspaces Last 30 Days
frame.description: Based on Jobs Clusters & Serverless Jobs Cost

frame.title: Top 25 Jobs by Potential Savings per Month
frame.description: These jobs provide highest ROI for optimization because they tend to be both pricey to run and also not close to fully leveraging harward potential. The calculation is optimistic-- it assumes that if you are at 20% utilization you can get similar performance with 20% of the hardware. Total savings would likely be lower.

frame.title: Top 10 Jobs with Lowest Avg CPU Utilization
frame.description: These jobs are not close to fully leveraging the hardware potential - consider reducing cores or removing single-threaded code/ manual repartitions.

frame.title: Top 10 Jobs with Highest Avg Memory Utilization
frame.description: These jobs could experience bottlenecks - consider increasing memory allocation.

frame.title: Jobs with Fixed Number of Workers Last 30 Days
frame.description: These jobs do not leverage autoscaling, consider adding it to optimise the resources utilisation.

frame.title: Jobs Running on Outdated DBR Version Last 30 Days
frame.description: These jobs are on old runtimes - consider upgrading to ensure optimal performance and ability to use new features

widget.name: fecc5ab7
widget.textbox_spec:
## Job Clusters Analysis 
----
The below charts and tables enrich job system table data with compute system table data to identify jobs with low CPU utilization, jobs with high memory utilization, jobs w/o scaling or auto-terminate, and jobs on low DBRs. Further it provides a ballpark estimate of jobs with highest savings potential based on current spend and current utilization. 

For the following charts to work you need to leverage:
- lakeflow system tables
- compute system tables, include node_timeline Private Preview

frame.title: Untagged Jobs Last 30 Days
frame.description: These jobs are not tagged and have been run in last 30 days; consider tagging them for cost attribution

frame.title: Most Frequent Jobs on All Purpose Clusters Last 30 Days
frame.description: High frequency jobs executed on all purpose clusters might prevent them from shutting down.

frame.title: All Purpose Clusters with the Highest Job Run Frequency Last 30 Days
frame.description: List of your all purpose clusters most frequently used to run jobs on.

frame.title: Number of jobs
frame.description: Eg. showing 5 most expensive jobs in the last 30 days
